title: MLBALL User without MVPD-auth - MLB.TV EPG
custom_preconds: Given there is a live ASG US feed
custom_steps:
When the user is logged in with an MLBALL account
and attempts to access the ASG US feed from the MLB.TV EPG

(tap game tile to bring up feed selector)
custom_expected: Then they will be taken to the ASG MVPD auth flow webview

title: MLBALL User without MVPD-auth - Scoreboard
custom_preconds: Given there is a live ASG US feed
custom_steps:
When the user is logged in with an MLBALL account
and attempts to access the ASG US feed from the Scoreboard

(expand game drawer for ASG, and then tap the MLB.TV deep link to bring up feed selector)
custom_expected: Then they will be taken to the ASG MVPD auth flow webview

title: MLBALL User without MVPD-auth - Team Page
custom_preconds: Given there is a live ASG US feed
custom_steps:
When the user is logged in with an MLBALL account
and attempts to access the ASG US feed from any Team Page

(tap MLB.TV deep link from top schedule snapshot to bring up feed selector)
custom_expected: Then they will be taken to the ASG MVPD auth flow webview

title: MLBALL User without MVPD-auth - Gameday Videos
custom_preconds: Given there is a live ASG US feed
custom_steps:
When the user is logged in with an MLBALL account
and attempts to access the ASG US feed from Gameday Videos

(while ASG is live, nav to Gameday Videos tab, and select US feed)
custom_expected: Then they will be taken to the ASG MVPD auth flow webview

title: MLBALL User - Successful MVPD auth - MLB.TV EPG
custom_preconds: Given there is a live ASG US feed
custom_steps:
When the user is logged in with an MLBALL account that does not have MVPD auth
and attempts to access the ASG US feed from the MLB.TV EPG
(tap game tile to bring up feed selector)
and successfully links their account via the auth flow
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the stream

title: Auth to Account without FOX
custom_preconds: Given there is a live ASG US feed
custom_steps:
When the user is logged in with an entitled account that does not have MVPD auth
and attempts to access the ASG US feed from MLB.TV EPG, Scoreboard, Team Page, or Gameday Videos
and links to a cable account that is not entitled for FOX
custom_expected: Then the user will get relevant messaging in the webview about not being entitled

(tap game tile)
custom_expected: Then the archive feed will launch

title: Single Team User without MVPD - Archive - Gameday Videos
custom_preconds: Given there is an ASG archive feed
custom_steps:
When the user is logged in with a Single Team account that does not have MVPD auth
and attempts to access the ASG archive feed from Gameday Videos

(there should only be one feed available)
custom_expected: Then the archive feed will launch

title: Backgrounding App -> Default Reset Time -> Less than 6 Hours
custom_preconds:
* MLB App is installed 
* Reset time is set and the user backgrounds the app
custom_steps: Given the user backgrounds the app for less than 6 hours
custom_expected: then user should be left on the same view

title: Backgrounding App -> Default Reset Time -> More than 6 Hours
custom_preconds:
* MLB App is installed 
* Reset time is set and the user backgrounds the app
custom_steps: Given the user backgrounds the app for more than 6 hours
custom_expected: then user should be reset to the default view

title: Tracker Webview
custom_steps:
When the Scoreboard override for the Home Run Derby tracker webview has been added
and the user navs to that date on the Scoreboard
(day before the All Star Game)
custom_expected: Then the HRD tracker webview will load

title: Tracker Updating
custom_preconds: Given the HRD tracker webview override is in place
custom_steps: While the HRD is updating
custom_expected: Then the user will see the updates reflected in real time on the tracker webview

title: Pitch Clock
custom_preconds: Given the HRD tracker webview override is in place
custom_steps: When a batter is up
custom_expected: Then the user will see the batter's pitch clock and it will update

title: Home Runs
custom_preconds: Given the HRD tracker webview override is in place
custom_steps: When a batter is up
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the field graphic
and it will fit correctly on the device screen
and any home runs hit will be correctly plotted on the image

title: Returning to Tracker
custom_preconds: Given the HRD tracker webview override is in place
custom_steps:
When the user exits the HRD tracker to view another page in the app
and then returns to the tracker
custom_expected: Then the tracker will continue to update

title: Team Page Schedule Snapshot
custom_preconds:
Given the team schedule override is in place

https://atbatappconfig.mlb.com/ios/11.4.0/apple-config-app-config.json

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the device date is on the Home Run Derby date
and the user navs to any team page
(check iPhone & iPad)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the team page schedule snapshot will default to the HRD date
and the user will see "HRD" in the date block with the correct time
and the module will include the HRD logo, time, event name, ballpark name and location
and links to Preview and Videos

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the device date is either the day before or the day after the HRD date
and the user navs to any team page, on an iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the team page schedule module will include the time, logo, event name, Preview/Videos links
and will NOT include the venue name and location

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Preview link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to appropriate HRD preview content

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Videos link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to appropriate HRD video content

custom_steps_separated.content: When the HRD is live and the override status string has been updated
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the status reflected in the date block and in the schedule module
and will no longer see the event time

custom_steps_separated.content: When the HRD is final and the override status string has been updated
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the status reflected in the date block and in the schedule module
and will not see the event time

title: Team Page Calendar View
custom_preconds:
Given the team schedule override is in place

https://atbatappconfig.mlb.com/ios/11.4.0/apple-config-app-config.json

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user launches the team schedule anytime before the HRD has begun
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the Home Run Derby appearing on its appropriate date on the calendar
and it will be labeled "HRD" with the event time

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user launches the team schedule while the HRD is live and the override status string has been updated
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the Home Run Derby appearing on its appropriate date on the calendar
and it will be labeled "HRD" with status text
and the user will not see the event time

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user launches the team schedule while the HRD is final and the override status string has been updated
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the Home Run Derby appearing on its appropriate date on the calendar
and it will be labeled "HRD" with status text
and the user will not see the event time

title: Team Page List View (iPhone only)
custom_preconds:
Given the team schedule override is in place

https://atbatappconfig.mlb.com/ios/11.4.0/apple-config-app-config.json

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user launches the team schedule List view anytime before the HRD has begun
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the Home Run Derby appearing on its appropriate date on the list view
with the correct logo and event time
and no Tickets link

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user launches the team schedule List view while the HRD is live and the override status string has been updated
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the Home Run Derby appearing on its appropriate date on the calendar
with its logo and the override status text
and the user will not see the event time

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user launches the team schedule List view while the HRD is final and the override status string has been updated
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the Home Run Derby appearing on its appropriate date on the calendar
with its logo and the override status text
and the user will not see the event time

title: Regular Season Games
custom_preconds:
Given the team schedule override is in place

https://atbatappconfig.mlb.com/ios/11.4.0/apple-config-app-config.json

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps any other game on the schedule calendar view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the appropriate Gameday link will launch

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps any other game on the schedule list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the appropriate Gameday link will launch

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the team page schedule module and taps any Gameday link for a regular season game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the appropriate Gameday link will launch
